item.title: Linux Process States
item.description: Table of Contents 1 The Linux Process States 1.1 Running or Runnable State (R) 1.2 Sleeping State: Interruptible (S) and Uninterruptible (D) 1.3 Stopped State (T) 1.4 Zombie State (Z) 2 Checking Process State 2.1 Displaying Process State Using ps 2.2 Using the top Command 2.3 The /proc Pseudo File 3 Summary 1 The Linux Process States Running or Runnable (R) Uninterruptible Sleep (D) Interruptable Sleep (S) Stopped (T) Zombie
